definitions.definition: A relaxed mood.
To make mellow; to relax or soften.
definitions.example: The fervour of early feeling is tempered and mellowed by the ripeness of age.

definitions.definition: To become mellow.
Soft or tender by reason of ripeness; having a tender pulp.
definitions.example: a mellow apple

definitions.definition: Easily worked or penetrated; not hard or rigid.
definitions.example: a mellow soil

definitions.definition: Not coarse, rough, or harsh; subdued, soft, rich, delicate; said of sound, color, flavor, style, etc.
Well matured; softened by years; genial; jovial.
Relaxed; calm; easygoing; laid-back.
Warmed by liquor, slightly intoxicated, stoned, or high.
The area which separates opposing lanes of traffic on a motorway or dual carriageway.
A collection of wind turbines, especially a large-scale array, used to generate electricity.
Of or relating to the affairs of a bishop in various Christian churches.
A type of pasta, thinner than spaghetti or vermicelli.
(by extension) fios de ovos (traditional Portuguese sweet food)
A sticky, fibrous substance reported in connection with UFO sightings and other paranormal manifestations.
Good; in acceptable, if not excellent condition.
definitions.example: The car is all right. It gets me there, anyway.

definitions.definition: In good health, unharmed.
definitions.example: I had a headache earlier, but now I'm all right.

definitions.definition: Used to indicate acknowledgement or acceptance; OK.
A generic greeting; hello; how are you.

The art and practice of conducting international relations by negotiating alliances, treaties, agreements etc., bilaterally or multilaterally, between states and sometimes international organizations, or even between polities with varying status, such as those of monarchs and their princely vassals.
definitions.example: National diplomacy typically deploys its dexterity to secure advantage for one's nation.

definitions.definition: Tact and subtle skill in dealing with people so as to avoid or settle hostility.

Short wavelength electromagnetic radiation usually produced by bombarding a metal target in a vacuum. Used to create images of the internal structure of objects; this is possible because X-rays pass through most objects and can expose photographic film.
definitions.example: X-rays are light with a wavelength between 0.1 and 10 nm.

definitions.definition: A radiograph: a photograph made with X-rays.
definitions.example: "The doctor ordered some X-rays of my injured wrist."

definitions.definition: An X-ray machine.
The letter X in the ICAO spelling alphabet.
To take a radiograph of; to obtain an image of using X-ray radiation, especially for the purpose of medical diagnostic evaluation.
definitions.example: Of course there was nothing wrong with my left wrist. They X-rayed the wrong arm!

definitions.definition: A lay person who reads aloud certain religious texts in a church service.
A public lecturer or reader at some universities.
(cigar industry) A person who reads aloud to workers to entertain them, appointed by a trade union.
A tightly-compressed bandage used to stop bleeding by stopping the flow of blood through a large artery in a limb.
Any of several similar methods of clamping components into position.
A turnstile.
Sweet talk.
Charming, confident and elegant.
To drive a motor vehicle in order to evaluate it, especially before potential purchase
To fight with allies or other members of the same group.
To box while extremely close to an opponent
Fighting or quarreling among the members of a single group or side.
Fighting with one's opponent closer than arm's length.
A short mid-morning break taken around eleven o'clock for a drink or light snack.
(of a trait or a disease) Present since birth.
Agitation of the surface of a fluid by fermentation or some other cause; a rippling on the surface of water.
Agitation of the mind marked by complaint and impatience; disturbance of temper; irritation.
definitions.example: He keeps his mind in a continual fret.

definitions.definition: Herpes; tetter.
(in the plural) The worn sides of riverbanks, where ores or stones containing them accumulate after being washed down from higher ground, which thus indicate to miners the locality of veins of ore.
Especially when describing animals: to consume, devour, or eat.
To chafe or irritate; to worry.
To make rough, to agitate or disturb; to cause to ripple.
definitions.example: to fret the surface of water

definitions.definition: In the form fret out: to squander, to waste.
To gnaw; to consume, to eat away.
To be chafed or irritated; to be angry or vexed; to utter peevish expressions through irritation or worry.
To be worn away; to chafe; to fray.
definitions.example: A wristband frets on the edges.

definitions.definition: To be anxious, to worry.
To be agitated; to rankle; to be in violent commotion.
definitions.example: Rancour frets in the malignant breast.

definitions.definition: To have secondary fermentation (fermentation occurring after the conversion of sugar to alcohol in beers and wine) take place.
An ornamental pattern consisting of repeated vertical and horizontal lines, often in relief.
A saltire interlaced with a mascle.
To decorate or ornament, especially with an interlaced or interwoven pattern, or with carving or relief (raised) work.
To form a pattern on; to variegate.
To cut through with a fretsaw, to create fretwork.
A ferrule, a ring.
One of the pieces of metal, plastic or wood across the neck of a guitar or other string instrument that marks where a finger should be positioned to depress a string as it is played.
To bind, to tie, originally with a loop or ring.
Musical senses.
A channel, a strait; a fretum.
A channel or passage created by the sea.
A fog or mist at sea, or coming inland from the sea.
A junkyard, a place where scrap is stored, discarded or resold.
A bishop empowered to oversee other bishops; an archbishop.
The inhabitant of a metropolis.
Pertaining to the see or province of a metropolitan.
Of, or pertaining to, a metropolis or other large urban settlement.
In England, the final two years of secondary schooling during which students are about sixteen to eighteen years of age.
A positive emotion including wonder and approbation; the regarding of another as being wonderful
definitions.example: They looked at the landscape in admiration.

definitions.definition: Wondering or questioning (without any particular positive or negative attitude to the subject).
Cause of admiration; something to excite wonder, or pleased surprise.
Real estate; a piece of real property; land.
The property that goes to the heirs of the deceased, as distinguished from the personalty, which goes to the executor or administrator of the estate.
Reality
Loyalty; faithfulness; fealty
Royalty
Any of the carnivorous freshwater fish living in South American rivers and belonging to the subfamily Serrasalminae.
A state of physical or mental weakness.
To disconcert someone with an unblinking face-to-face confrontation; to stare down; to withsay
To boldly confront a situation.
To prepare for trouble.
One who is extremely poor.
One living on or eligible for public charity.
A wild ox, Bison bonasus.
A similar North American animal, Bison bison.
A person who conducts a radio program of recorded music combined with talk, news, commercials, weather, etc.
A person who plays, and sometimes mixes, recorded music at nightclubs, dances, parties, or some other social event; and/or as a backup musician for spoken word, or hip hop performers.
To park a car next to a car already parked on the side of a street, obstructing traffic.
Welsh rarebit
An informer providing substantial quantities of information on criminal or terrorist activities to the police.
To add volume (to something).
definitions.example: Tired of her flat hairstyle, Vicki volumized her hair.

definitions.definition: An announcement by a company to its shareholders and other investors that its profits are likely to be less than expected.
Any of two or more alternative pronunciations for a phoneme.
definitions.example: [ʋ] is occasionally considered to be an allophone of /v/

definitions.definition: A person whose mother tongue is neither English, French nor an Indigenous language of Canada.
A person whose mother tongue is one other than that spoken by the majority.
Of or relating to those whose mother tongue is neither English, French nor an Indigenous language of Canada
That which is of a language other than that spoken by the majority.
A road in which the two directions of traffic are separated by a central barrier or strip of land, known as a central reservation or median.
An airy pudding served chilled, particularly chocolate mousse.
A savory dish, of meat or seafood, containing gelatin.
definitions.example: ham mousse

definitions.definition: A styling cream used for hair.
definitions.example: He slicked his hair back with mousse, but the cowlick still stuck up.

definitions.definition: A stable emulsion of water and oil that is created by wave action churning the water where an oil spill occurs.
To apply mousse (styling cream).
definitions.example: He moussed his hair in the morning and then washed it out at night.

definitions.definition: A small keyboard instrument that consists of a series of reed pipes, which sound when one of the keys is pressed to open a valve that allows air to pass through.
One who sets the pace in a race, to guide the others.
A set of nerves which stimulate the heart to beat.
(hence) A medical implement that is used to stimulate a heart to beat by simulating the action of the natural pacemaker.
A person who restores peace, especially by settling disputes.
Nearest the stern of a vessel; hindmost.
A web page at which a user first arrives at a website.
In preference; by choice; in a preferable manner.
A ruminant mammal with antlers and hooves of the family Cervidae, or one of several similar animals from related families of the order Artiodactyla
(in particular) one of the smaller animals of this family, distinguished from a moose or elk
definitions.example: I wrecked my car after a deer ran across the road.

definitions.definition: The meat of such an animal; venison.
definitions.example: Oh, I've never had deer before.

definitions.definition: (except in the phrase "small deer") an animal, especially a quadrupedal mammal, as opposed to a bird, fish, etc.
The middle of winter.
The winter solstice; about December 21st or 22nd.
A species of small European owl, Athene noctua.
A portion of the esophagus of either a bird or an annelid that contains ingested grit and is used to grind up ingested food before it is transferred to the stomach.
A person's natural inclination; unforced choice
The ability to choose one's actions, or determine what reasons are acceptable motivation for actions, without predestination, fate etc.
A shop to where goods are donated, and sold on at cheap prices, with all the profits going to charity
The repetition of consonant sounds, but not vowels as in assonance.
Harmony; agreement; lack of discordance.
A person who engages in stalking, i.e. quietly approaching animals to be hunted; a tracker or guide in hunting game.
A person who secretly follows someone, sometimes with unlawful intentions.
Any of various devices for removing the stalk from plants during harvesting.
Any bird that walks with a stalking motion.
A kind of fishing net.
A swimming stroke swum on the swimmer's side.
Produced by genetic modification; abbreviation GM.
definitions.example: Genetically modified foods have been the subject of heated debate.

definitions.definition: (in the plural) The practicing members of a religion or followers of a cause.
definitions.example: The faithful pray five times a day.

definitions.definition: Someone or something that is faithful or reliable.
Loyal; adhering firmly to person or cause.
definitions.example: My dog is a very faithful dog: he doesn't like to be petted by anybody else.

definitions.definition: Having faith.
Reliable; worthy of trust.
definitions.example: My servant is very faithful.

definitions.definition: Consistent with reality.
definitions.example: I would consider that a very faithful reproduction.

definitions.definition: Engaging in sexual relations only with one's spouse or long-term sexual partner.
definitions.example: They had been faithful to each other all of their married life.

definitions.definition: (mathematics) Injective in specific contexts, e.g. of representations in representation or functors in category theory.
An executioner responsible for hanging criminals.
(games) A guessing game where one has to guess the word an opponent is thinking of by guessing one letter at a time, and involving the gradual drawing of a stick figure hanging from the gallows.
A cut of beef from the lower part of the back, where the last ribs are (called rump in UK English).
A cut of beef from the middle of the back (corresponding to short loin and partly rib in US English).
A commanding officer, usually of a specific force or division.
A small bedroom in a house, often used for storage.
A loud calling or crying out, for example as in surprise, pain, grief, joy, anger, etc.
A word expressing outcry; an interjection
A clause type used to make an exclamatory statement: What a mess they made!; How stupid I was!
The sign "!" by which outcry or emphatic utterance is marked.
A set of rules that govern how words are combined to form phrases and sentences.
The formal rules of formulating the statements of a computer language.
The study of the structure of phrases, sentences and language.
A musical composition, often based on a religious theme; similar to opera but with no costume, scenery or acting.
The sesamoid bone of the knee; the kneecap.
A little dish or vase.
(of a person) Having genetic characteristics of two or more different races.
The disease or disorder of abnormally low blood pressure.
To eat (parts of) another of one's own species.
definitions.example: The female black widow spider is known to cannibalise the male.

definitions.definition: To remove parts of (a machine, etc) for use in other similar machines.
To reduce sales or market share (for one of one's own products) by introducing another.
Rework old material; rehash.
A pair of high-heeled shoes.
definitions.example: I look sexier in high heels.

definitions.definition: A consonant articulated by the lips.
An organ pipe having a lip that influences its sound.
Any of the scales bordering the mouth opening of a reptile.
Of or pertaining to the lips or labia.
Articulated by the lips, as the consonants b, m and w.
Of an incisor or canine, on the side facing the lips. See mesial.
Furnished with lips.
definitions.example: a labial organ pipe

definitions.definition: One of the hairs which grow along the edge of eyelids
Those people at the top of a social hierarchy
The aristocracy
To have, show or express sympathy; to be affected by feelings similar to those of another, in consequence of knowing the person to be thus affected.
To support, favour, have sympathy (with a political cause or movement, a side in a conflict / in an action).
To say in an expression of sympathy.
To have a common feeling, as of bodily pleasure or pain.
To share (a feeling or experience).
To agree; to be in accord; to harmonize.
